instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
hello,
can someone help me with this board please im new in this and i cant figure out what is wrong with this board,
i have already tried another DC in board, i have only a dimmed green light on the charger almost invisible

i have done some measurements:

PPBUS_G3H = 8.58V

PP3V42_G3H = 3.41V

PPBUS_G3H_R = 8.59V

PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R = 16.64V

SMC_RESET_L = 3.38V

J7000 = pin 1 and 2= 16.66V

j7000 = pin 3 =0V

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum!

Did you try known good LIO flex too?
Inspect J9500 solders, especially pins 19/21.

Board must turn on without LIO flex connected; no Magsafe light, of course.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
hello, 
no i did not try an new flex cable because i dont have one, J9500 pins look perfect  i see nowhere corrosion or something,
what else can it be? does the PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R have to be around 18v? because i have 16.6V can this be the issue?

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
DCIN depends of charger type used.

We can help better if you reply to the questions...

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message: im using 85W charger, and i do have 3V3_S5 i have measured 3.32V on C8130 and on C8309

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
What about 3V3_SUS???
Pay atention when you read and earn time; should be your interest...

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message: I cant find the 3V3_SUS  thats why i thought that you mean maybe sys? But i didnt find it either, can you tel me where it is located on the board?

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message: Sorry i did find it now and its also 3.32V

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
Post PM_RSMRST_L, PM_PWRBTN_L, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD and PM_BATLOW_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L (use R5115/16 pads) and check for drop pulse at same time on PM_PWRBTN_L.
If yes, check for pulse at all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals too.

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
hello, sorry for the late reply. these are the measurements.

PM_RSMRST_L = measured on R8133 3.19V

PCH_DSWVRMEN= R1450 3.02V

PM_DSW_PWRGD = R1451 3.41V

PM_BATLOW_L = Q3000 3.31V

PM_PWRBTN_L, 3.40V when pressed  drops to0.35V

PM_PWRBTN_L is 3.4V and when SMC_ONOFF_L triggered the voltage drops to 0.35V

PM_SLP_S0_L =  0.4V and when SMC_ONOFF_L triggered the voltage stays the same 

PM_SLP_S3_L = is always 0V

PM_SLP_S4_L = is always 0V

PM_SLP_S5_L = is always 0V

PM_SLP_SUS_L = is always 3.3V

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
More likely the problem is on PCH side, if you don't get reaction at PM_SLP_S5_L at least.
Check first all RTC signals, RTC_RESET_L, PCH_SRTCRST_L, PCH_INTRUDER_L and PCH_INTVRMEN.
Also see what happens when U1930 is removed.

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
RTC_RESET_L  = 3.31V
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.30V 
 PCH_INTRUDER_L  = 2.95V
 PCH_INTVRMEN 3.31V

i have removed the u1930 but what for changes should i be looking for?
i will have to order new U1930 because its damaged

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
Sorry, I mixed posts and schematics.
Remove U8130 and check if you get voltage on big coils.
No need to solder U1930 yet, for test.
If you get at leat pulsing at 5V and RAM coils, then need to solder U1930.

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message: i did remove the U8130 but there was no difference, i did see some corrosion around Q8150 but i have cleaned it all can the issue be there?

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message: Remove Q8150, is not really needed; redundant protection...

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
i have removed it but still the same..i think i will pass on this board and use it just for parts because i have one more board that is working but only the backlight is not working. when i turn on the macbook the backlight voltage is slowly dropping from 19V to 8.49V..
and i have already replaced the backlight driver.

threads.title: 820-00165 air 13 2015 NO POWER
threads.message:
Please open new thread for other board; even if is same model.
Different problem must be treated separately.
